document.ModsDocTitle: Three new rotundabaloghid mites (Acari, Uropodina) from Sabah (Malaysia)
document.masterDocTitle: Three new rotundabaloghid mites (Acari, Uropodina) from Sabah (Malaysia)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new rotundabaloghid mites (Acari, Uropodina) from Sabah (Malaysia)

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype: female. Sab-82/7. Malaysia: Sabah (Sandakan Residency): 15 milles (24 km) W de Sandakan: Sepilok: "Kabili-Sepilok Forest Reserve", foret pres du "Pond" ( etang formant la reserve d'eau pour Sepilok), tamisage de feuilles mortes et de bois pourri, Secondary Lowland Forest; 23.IV.1982; leg. B.Hauser (appareil Winkler-Moczarski a Sepilok). Paratypes: four females. Locality and date same as in holotype.

Genital shield of female with a long apical process and its surface covered by oval pits. Setae V7 and V8 smooth and needle-like, situated near end of pedofossae IV on small figlets. Setae on dorsal side of body pilose.
Length of idiosoma 290-320 μm , width 280-290 μm (n = 5). Shape circular, posterior margin rounded, color reddish-brown.
Dorsal idiosoma (Figure 1). Marginal and dorsal shields fused. Dorsal setae basally curved, margins pilose (ca 22-26 μm long) (Figure 2). Surface of dorsal body covered by small oval pits (Figure 2).

caption.paragraph: Figures 1-4. Angulobaloghia rutra sp. n., female, holotype: 1 body in dorsal view 2 setae and ornamentation in dorsal shield 3 body in ventral view 4 intercoxal area of female.

Figures 5-10. Angulobaloghia rutra sp. n., female, holotype: 5 tritosternum 6 ventral view of gnathosoma, tritosternum and part of coxae I 7 ventral view of leg I 8 ventral view of leg II 9 ventral view of leg III 10 ventral view of leg IV.

subSubSection.paragraph: Legs (Figures 7-10). All legs with ambulacral claws and smooth and needle-like setae, femora II-Iv with flap-like ventral process.
The name of the new species refers to the shape of the female's genital shield. The linguliform genital shield with the long apical process resembles a shovel (= rutrum in Latin).

The new species differs from the other known Angulobaloghia species by the apical process and pit-like ornamentation of the genital shield in females. Most other known Angulobaloghia species have female genital shields that are triangular, semicircular or bottle-like. Only one species [ Angulobaloghia vietnamensis ( Kontschan , 2008)] has a linguliform genital shield, but the apical process is short and spine-like. In contrast, females of the new species have a long and apically serrate genial process.
